title.narrative: Youth Advocacy for Youth Friendly Policy

description.narrative: Youth in Cambodia comprises almost 20% of the total population. While other countries in Asia is expected to decline by 2030, the proportion of youth in the population in Cambodia is foreseen to be increased in 2035 with average annual growth of 0.1% from 2005-2015 and 1.0% from 2025-2035. Another study in 2009 indicated that young people in the age group 10-24 comprising 36 per cent of the population. Despite rapid economic growth, youth still unemployed, and that has consequence on their livelihoods and the loss of labor force due to the migration to find better jobs in other countries. The overarching vision of the Royal Government of Cambodia#s first National Policy on Cambodian Youth Development endorsed by Council of Minister (CoM) on 24 June 2011stated that 'Youth have opportunities to develop their potential, to access education, employment, and health services and to participate in decision making, and to contribute to family, community , national, and global development. The policy is a commitment of government to develop youth in Cambodia and assure their rights to participate in politics and decision-making. The policy is enlarging the space for young people#s participation at the sub-national democratic development. Although the national youth policy has already been endorsed by the Council of Minister (CoM), there remains a real need for a comprehensive multi-sectoral enforcement. Such enforcement requires a clear operational procedure from national to sub-national and grassroots level inorder to guide long term strategic planning that will target public and private sector investments in the areas of education and vocational training, employment, gender, volunteerism, as well as health care and awareness among youth and young people in Cambodia. Therefore, the monitoring and evolution mechanism needs to monitor the implementation mechanism; nationwide destination workshop or launching on NYP need to be conducted; and the National Youth Commission (NYC) needs to establish with participationfrom multiple stakeholders. To achieve this, YCUD will put more effort into bringing youth to participate in monitoring and evaluation and to work collectively with other youth organizations and relevant stakeholders. The project aims to mobilize different youth organizations, networks and sectors to influence policy development and enforcement in order to enhance civic space for the youth to voice their concerns on youth related issues. It will also engage decision-makers (political parties, NEC and national government) for dialogue on youth issues (youth quota and youth policy for political parties) and enhance civic space especially the youth.

participating-org.narrative:
YCUD was founded by leaders of various Cambodian Youth Organizations (KIND, KYA, KYSD, PDP-Center, YFP, YCC, YRDP). It is governed by a Governance Board. YCUD promotes good governance and accountability not only for itself, but also for Cambodian youth, communitypeople, and government institutions. The key principle of YCUD is to unite all Cambodia Youth Organizations toward a common goal, in the interest and for the sake of Cambodian youth.
YCUD represents effective coordination, fast and dynamic information sharing, strong and peaceful advocacy, high technological communication within members and stakeholders, standardized capacity development andmonitoring, evaluation and research on Cambodian Youth.
YCUD contributed toward the achievement of a National Youth Policy which was adopted by the Ministry of Education, Youth and Sport, Royal Government of Cambodia. Monitoring the enforcement and implementation of the National Youth Policy is a main goal of YCUD.
Youth Coalition for Unity and Devel
